chunks.text: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Goods Receiving

metadata.section_title: Standard Operating Procedure for Goods Receiving
metadata.context: Title of the SOP document for goods receiving

chunks.text: This procedure ensures that all incoming goods are handled efficiently, accurately, and safely, adhering to the Quality Policy and preventing stock reconciliation errors.

metadata.section_title: Standard Operating Procedure for Goods Receiving
metadata.context: Overview of the SOP's purpose and adherence to quality policy
Defines the purpose of the SOP for goods receiving

chunks.text: To establish a uniform and controlled process for the receipt, inspection, and recording of all incoming cargo and materials, ensuring compliance with client instructions and minimizing discrepancies.

metadata.context: Establishes a controlled process for receiving goods
Lists the steps involved in the goods receiving procedure

chunks.text:
Step | Action | Responsibility | Quality/Safety Check
2.1 | Vehicle/Cargo Check-in | Gate Guard / Receiving Clerk | Verify the transporter's details against the expected Delivery Order (DO) or Advanced Shipping Notice (ASN). Check the vehicle for signs of tampering or damage before docking.

metadata.context: Details the vehicle and cargo check-in process

chunks.text: 2.2 | Unloading Preparation | Receiving Supervisor | Clear the staging area. Ensure all required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is worn by the unloading team (safety vest, hard hat, steel-toed boots).
2.3 | Unloading and Tally | Warehouse Operator | Unload cargo carefully. Perform a preliminary count (tally) against the accompanying shipper's Bill of Lading (BOL).

metadata.context: Describes the unloading and tallying process

chunks.text: 2.4 | Initial Quality Inspection | Receiving Clerk | Mandatory Check: Inspect every pallet/carton for visible damage (crushing, wetness, torn seals). If damage is found, document it immediately on the BOL and take photo evidence.

metadata.context: Initial quality inspection process for received goods

chunks.text: 2.5 | WMS Receiving & Validation | Receiving Clerk | Using the handheld scanner, scan the shipment reference/BOL number. Enter the verified quantity into the Warehouse Management System (WMS). The WMS generates a System Receiving Report.

metadata.context: Process for receiving and validating goods in WMS

chunks.text: 2.6 | Discrepancy Resolution | Receiving Supervisor | If there is a quantity mismatch or damage, the clerk must immediately notify the client or relevant internal department. No stock is put away until the discrepancy is acknowledged.

metadata.context: Steps for resolving discrepancies in received goods

chunks.text: 2.7 | Put-Away & Location Assignment | Warehouse Operator | Move the verified and received stock to its assigned bin or storage area (Ambient, Cold, or Temperature-Controlled). Scan the item and the storage location to confirm placement in the WMS.

metadata.context: Process for putting away and assigning location to goods

chunks.text: 2.8 | Document Filing | Receiving Clerk | Attach the signed BOL, the System Receiving Report, and any Discrepancy Reports. File documents for record-keeping and reconciliation.

metadata.context: Checklist for receiving and dispatch control

chunks.text:
● [ ] ASN/DO verified against physical shipment.
● [ ] Total Piece Count verified (Tally vs. BOL).
● [ ] Cargo inspected for damage (Pass/Fail).
● [ ] WMS entry completed and System Receiving Report generated.
● [ ] Discrepancy logged and resolution confirmed (if applicable).
● [ ] Final put-away scan confirmed in WMS.

metadata.context: Checklist items for verifying receiving and dispatch processes
